## Chapter 1

Import libraries and read in Data Sets


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Import functions into the code
pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse)
#import geospatial data into R
mpsz = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\clshi2022\ISSS624\HandsOnEx\HandsOnEx01\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cyclingpath = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "CyclingPathGazette")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```{.r .cell-code}
#import listings into R
preschool = st_read("data/geospatial/pre-schools-location-kml.kml")
```

```{.r .cell-code}
listings <- read_csv("data/aspatial/listings.csv")
```
:::


Checking the content of a Simple Feature Data Frame


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Various ways to peek into the data set
st_geometry(mpsz)
```

Plotting the Geospatial Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Plotting is only for quick look, t.map is preferred for more detailed maps
plot(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(st_geometry(mpsz))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz["PLN_AREA_N"])
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Projection Transformation

(It is important to transform data sets into the same coordinate system for data wrangling)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Used to check the Coordiante Reference System
st_crs(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: SVY21 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21[WGS84]",
        DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
            ID["EPSG",6326]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]]],
    CONVERSION["unnamed",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["(E)",east,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]],
        AXIS["(N)",north,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]]]
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Change to correct format
mpsz3414 <- st_set_crs(mpsz, 3414)
st_crs(mpsz3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414 
  wkt:

        DATUM["SVY21",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,

        ID["EPSG",4757]],

        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",

            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],

            ID["EPSG",8802]],

        AXIS["easting (E)",east,
```

:::


Transforming Pre-school from one coordinate system to another


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool3414 <- st_transform(preschool, crs = 3414)
```
:::


Creating data frame from aspatial data frame


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#list the csv data
list(listings)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```{.r .cell-code}
#transforming into geosptial data
listings_sf <- st_as_sf(listings, 
                       coords = c("longitude", "latitude"),
                       crs=4326) %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
#We can now use the glimpse function to check the data frame
glimpse(listings_sf)
```

Buffering


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
buffer_cycling <- st_buffer(cyclingpath, 
                               dist=5, nQuadSegs = 30)
buffer_cycling$AREA <- st_area(buffer_cycling)
sum(buffer_cycling$AREA)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
1556978 [m^2]
```
:::
:::


Point-in-polygon count


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Compare intersects between two geospatial data sets
mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`<- lengths(st_intersects(mpsz3414, preschool3414))
summary(mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
   0.00    0.00    3.00    5.96    9.00   58.00 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#listing the planning subzone with the most number of pre-school
top_n(mpsz3414, 1, `PreSch Count`)
```

:::


DIY: Calculate the density of pre-school by planning subzone


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#derive area of each planning subzone
mpsz3414$Area <- mpsz3414 %>%
  st_area()
#compute density
mpsz3414 <- mpsz3414 %>%
  mutate(`PreSch Density` = `PreSch Count`/Area * 1000000)
```
:::


EDA (Showing Analysis)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Basic Histogram
hist(mpsz3414$`PreSch Density`)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Drawing with ggplot (Histogram)
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="black", 
                 fill="light blue") +
  labs(title = "Are pre-school evenly distributed in Singapore?",
       subtitle= "There are many planning sub-zones with a single pre-school, on the other hand, \nthere are two planning sub-zones with at least 20 pre-schools",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Frequency")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Drawing with ggplot (Scatter)
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, aes(x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`), y = as.numeric(`PreSch Count`)))+
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Are pre-school evenly distributed in Singapore?",
       subtitle= "There are many planning sub-zones with a single pre-school, on the other hand, \nthere are two planning sub-zones with at least 20 pre-schools",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Pre-school Count")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Chapter 2

Import libraries and read in Data Sets


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, tmap, tidyverse)
mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\clshi2022\ISSS624\HandsOnEx\HandsOnEx01\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata <- read_csv("data/aspatial/respopagesextod2011to2020.csv")
```
:::


Data wrangling


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2020 <- popdata %>%
  filter(Time == 2020) %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=AG, 
              values_from=POP) %>%
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         +rowSums(.[12])) %>%
mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:11])+
rowSums(.[13:15]))%>%
mutate(`AGED`=rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
mutate(`TOTAL`=rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%  
mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`)
/`ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`, 
       `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, 
       `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)
```
:::


Joining the attribute data and geospatial data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2020 <- popdata2020 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), 
          .funs = funs(toupper)) %>%
  filter(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` > 0)

mpsz_pop2020 <- left_join(mpsz, popdata2020,
                          by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))

write_rds(mpsz_pop2020, "data/rds/mpszpop2020.rds")
```
:::


Choropleth Mapping Geospatial Data using tmap


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
qtm(mpsz_pop2020, 
    fill = "DEPENDENCY")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "Dependency ratio") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio by planning subzone",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar() +
  tm_grid(alpha =0.2) +
  tm_credits("Source: Planning Sub-zone boundary from Urban Redevelopment Authorithy (URA)\n and Population data from Department of Statistics DOS", 
             position = c("left", "bottom"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-2.png){width=672}
:::

Multiple stand along maps with tmap_arrange()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
youngmap <- tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons("YOUNG", 
              style = "quantile", 
              palette = "Blues")

agedmap <- tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons("AGED", 
              style = "quantile", 
              palette = "Blues")

tmap_arrange(youngmap, agedmap, asp=1, ncol=2)
```

Mapping spatial object meeting a selection criterion


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues", 
          legend.hist = TRUE, 
          legend.is.portrait = TRUE,
          legend.hist.z = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(legend.outside = TRUE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 5.0,
            legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),
            frame = FALSE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```
